meanings.definition: Of the highest quality or degree of excellence.
meanings.sent1: The cake was the primmest dessert at the party.
meanings.sent2: She wore her primmest dress to the special event.
meanings.sent3: The primmest flower in the garden stood out among the rest.
meanings.sent4: His primmest painting captured the beauty of the sunset.
meanings.sent5: The primmest diamond sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To make something neat, tidy, or elegant in appearance.
meanings.sent1: She primmest the table before the guests arrived.
meanings.sent2: He always primmest his hair before going out.
meanings.sent3: The cat primmest its fur with meticulous grooming.
meanings.sent4: The gardener primmest the bushes into perfect shapes.
meanings.sent5: They primmest the room for the important meeting.

meanings.definition: To behave in a formal or proper manner.
meanings.sent1: She primmest at the royal ball.
meanings.sent3: The penguin primmest as it waddled across the ice.
meanings.sent4: The students primmest during the school assembly.
meanings.sent5: The butler primmest as he served the guests.
